MAC ADD(1) = ROUTER(1) MAC ADD(2) = ROUTER(2) MAC ADD(3) = RECEIVER(B)
@divyamtyagi3792  bro he asked that switches have mac address or not

Normally, L2 Switches do not have MAC Addresses. It’s just a simple device that builds a MAC address table and forwards frames. Switches when operating at layer 2 don't modify the source or destination MAC address. A router on the other hand, will modify the source MAC address, substituting the original source (Router or Destined Device) MAC address with it's own MAC address. That's enough to understand the answer.  There are Switches which can do the modification too. Answer may change in this case.
